title: Santiago Solari 'begged Real Madrid to recall Martin Odegaard from Vitesse loan'
text:
Former Real Madrid manager Santiago Solari 'begged the club to recall Martin Odegaard from his loan at Dutch club Vitesse' in the middle of last season.

Solari was in the job between October and March - between Julen Lopetegui and Zinedine Zidane - and reportedly made the request during the January transfer window amid poor results.

Radio Marca report that Solari wanted the Norway midfielder in his first-team squad as he tried to turn around their failing season.

Martin Odegaard (left) is spending this season on loan at Real Sociedad from Real Madrid

Santiago Solari reportedly wanted to recall Odegaard from his loan at Vitesse last season

Odegaard, 20, is out on loan at fellow La Liga club Real Sociedad this season and has impressed in the opening weeks of the campaign.

It is his third loan spell since arriving at Real Madrid in January 2015 having spent time at Dutch clubs Heerenveen and Vitesse in recent seasons.

Solari was sacked in March following Real's elimination from the Champions League at the hands of Ajax and a defeat by Clasico rivals Barcelona in the Copa del Rey.

Norway midfielder Odegaard celebrates during his loan spell at Vitesse last season

The Norwegian has made an impressive start to the Spanish league season with Sociedad

Zidane eventually guided Real to a third place finish in the league, some 21 points behind champions Barcelona and eight behind second-placed Atletico Madrid.

It has been reported that Real will have to pay Real Sociedad €2million (£1.72m) if they want to recall him from his present loan spell, although this has been denied.
